9.question: What is the difference between strongly typed and dynamically typed languages?
9.A: Strongly typed languages allow values to change in unexpected ways, while dynamically typed languages do not.
9.B: Strongly typed languages require type annotations, while dynamically typed languages do not.
9.C: Strongly typed languages do not allow values to change in unexpected ways, while dynamically typed languages do.
